abstract.p: Dr Connie Dong letter on Aug 1 article on Lasik procedure to correct vision problems; says patients will still need routine eye care

block.p: It is dangerous to suggest that anyone who has undergone a successful Lasik procedure no longer needs routine eye care (''Laser Eye Surgery's Turf War'').

Someone who was very nearsighted before the procedure may have 20/20 vision afterward without corrective lenses, but anatomically, that person is still very nearsighted and still at risk for retinal problems associated with myopia. It is simply a myth that someone who has clear vision without glasses has healthy eyes.

Optometrists do more than just fit glasses and contact lenses. We diagnose and medically treat eye diseases, and we do an excellent job co-managing surgical cases. We deliver the majority of routine eye care in the United States and, in what we probably do better than anyone else, provide a means to clearer vision, be it glasses, lenses or laser correction.
